description: [Daily Maverick] In an effort to bring the Olympics to a wider and younger audience, breaking is the latest "sport" to make its debut at Paris 2024. But how will it work as a scored sport?
title: Africa: How Breakdancing Became the Latest Olympic Sport

description: [Daily Maverick] Two environmental activists, born in remote farm villages along the Wild Coast, have been honoured with a global environmental award for their role in halting seismic blasting tests by the Shell oil and gas multinational off the Eastern Cape coastline.
title: Africa: Global Honour for Coastal Guardians Who Told Shell to Go to Hell

description: [New Era] South African High Commissioner to Namibia Thenjiwe Ethel Mtintso says Namibia played a critical role in the freedom and democracy of her nation.
title: Africa: Namibia Credited for South Africa's Freedom

description: [UNFPA] The United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) will join global leaders to call for renewed commitment towards progress on eradicating preventable maternal and newborn deaths at a 29 April event during the 57th Session of the Commission on Population and Development.
title: Africa: Urgent Call for Country Leadership and Global Solidarity to End Maternal and Newborn Deaths By 2030

description: [Jubilee] Washington, DC -- The World Bank program that provides aid to poor countries should triple funding by 2030, said interfaith African organizations in a statement addressed to leaders meeting in Nairobi. On April 29th, the President of Kenya, William Ruto, hosts the International Development Association (IDA) for Africa Heads of State Summit to mobilize funding for IDA. As the largest source of grants and low-cost, long-term loans to the poorest countries, IDA enables recipients to spend on poverty reduction and development
title: Africa: African Religious Organizations Call for Tripling Size of Vulnerable Countries Fund

description: [New Times] The Africa Soft Power Summit is set to return to Kigali for its third consecutive year from May 28th-31st. This was announced in a Kigali cocktail mixer event that was organised on Thursday April 25 in Kigali.
title: Africa: Africa Soft Power Summit Returns to Kigali for Third Time

description: [DW] Portuguese President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa had called for Lisbon to find ways to compensate its former colonies, including canceling debt. The government says it has not initiated any process to that effect.
title: Africa: Portugal Says No Plans to Pay Colonial Reparations

description: [The Conversation Africa] The "birds and the bees". The "facts of life". Whatever you call it, many parents dread discussing sex and sexuality with their teenagers. They may be embarrassed, or worried that they don't understand some concepts. In some countries, cultural norms may mean it's considered inappropriate for adults and adolescents to talk about sex.
title: Africa: Talking to Teens About Sex - Advice for Parents On When, How, What to Say and Why It's So Important

description: [Africa Renewal] Artisanal and Small-scale Miners (ASM) are the "orphans" of the mining world. The global mining industry, including some governments, perceives artisanal mining as a "residual sector." Yet over 40 million artisanal miners toil in mines around the world and contribute to local economies. Their labour helps respond to the growing demand for minerals used in everything from smartphones to solar panels and batteries and from roads and buildings.
title: Africa: Transforming Artisanal Mining Can Be Beneficial for People and the Planet

description: [Africa Renewal] UN Assistant Secretary-General for the Office of Rule of Law and Security Institutions, Alexandre Zouev, acknowledges progress amidst global tensions and challenges within countries
title: Africa: Many African Nations Are Making Progress in the Rule of Law
